result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott L Richardson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Maintain full time employment and/or school to obtain diploma.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Defendant Scott L Richardson in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 and Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. Atty. Stuller to file Pretrial Incarceration Credit form. Case recalled w/out the Attorneys present.  Court orders the 10 days credit be applied to the 10 months jail if revoked per stipulation of counsel.  

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 10 months jail with huber - credit for 10 days -  STAYED for 2 years Probation
- Court Costs of $268.00 -  costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00  - apply bail to Surcharge and refund balance
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety. Maintain any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. Maintain full-time employment and/or school to obtain diploma. DNA sample if not yet provided. 
- 90 jail days Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing October 13, 2014 by 7:00 p.m..   Non-working hours with standard release conditions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Scott L Richardson in court with attorney Virginia M. Stuller.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date as promply as possible. WCS report addressed. State requests bail be increased. Court will grant a request for a plea and sentencing. Court will not increase bail at this time. Defendant to remain compliant with WCS and report after court.  Court orders bail stand as fixed. Defendant to remain compliant with his Attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
